title: Patch keeps crashing unspecified error at 99%
body: It's been happening for the past patches now, I would have to re install league ever since patch 5.4. This is really irritating me now and I was wondering if I could somehow fix this. I've done everything, disable firewall, run as admin, did the repair files and disabled peer-to-peer transfer

replies.body:
Do you have anything editing files during the patching progress, like an automated cleaner? Disable it if you do.

Have you tried [changing your DNS to Google's Public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq4)?
I tried what u said, but it still shows up. Do u think theres anything else i could possibly do???

Ultimately, you can just reinstall League and see if that works. Of course, you probably don't want to do that because it takes ages to do.

You can try the following: Go to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_game_client in your Windows Explorer, if you're on Windows, and then delete the folder named "filearchives". On Mac, this can (probably) be done by right clicking the League of Legends icon and then searching through its contents. I don't use a Mac myself, so I can't be sure.

Best of luck.

Thanks man! I'm letting it download for now and it should work but if this happens for next patch i'm better of filing a complaint to riot. Thanks for everything {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

Riot will probably take a long time to get back to you on the matter, and in that time you'd probably be better off reinstalling League anyway, if internet usage doesn't cost you a considerable amount.

When I did it, they outright told me, "Your internet sucks, man."

Much support, yes. Don't even dare say that it's a fault in the coding or anything, just leave me be with my supposed bad connection.
